requirement_definitions.title: Calculus Prerequisite
requirement_definitions.narrative: Student must either complete or place out of second-semester calculus, i.e., MATH 100, 170, or 190. Note that students who have not had sufficient calculus in high school may need to take Math 90 (or other courses) before taking a second-semester calculus course.

requirement_definitions.title: Introductory Courses
requirement_definitions.narrative: Students must complete one introductory course sequence.

requirement_definitions.title: CSCI0150 (1.0): Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming and Computer Science
requirement_definitions.course_title: Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming and Computer Science

requirement_definitions.title: CSCI0180 (1.0): Computer Science: An Integrated Introduction
CSCI0190 (1.0): Accelerated Introduction to Computer Science
Advanced Intro course
requirement_definitions.narrative: Any more advanced course, or CSCI 0180.

requirement_definitions.title: Intermediate Courses
requirement_definitions.narrative: AB students must take a total of three intermediate courses covering at least two categories.

requirement_definitions.title: CSCI0220 (1.0): Introduction to Discrete Structures and Probability
requirement_definitions.course_title: Introduction to Discrete Structures and Probability

requirement_definitions.title: CSCI0530 (1.0): Directions: The Matrix in Computer Science
requirement_definitions.course_title: Directions: The Matrix in Computer Science

requirement_definitions.title: Pathways
requirement_definitions.narrative: Completing a pathway entails taking two courses in the pathway of which at least one is a core course for the pathway. One must also take the intermediate courses specified as part of the pathway.

requirement_definitions_json.title: Professional Track
requirement_definitions_json.narrative: To complete this track, students must complete the requirements for their concentrations and complete two two- to four-month full-time professional experiences, doing work that is related to their concentration programs. Such work is normally done within an industrial organization, but may also be at a university under the supervision of a faculty member. Document each professional experience here.

requirement_definitions.narrative: Upload documentation of your work experience here.

requirement_definitions.title: Self-Designed Pathway Proposal
requirement_definitions.narrative: Document your proposed pathway and upload it here.

requirement_definitions.title: Pathway course 1
requirement_definitions.narrative: Take a course.

requirement_definitions.title: Pathway course 2
requirement_definitions.narrative: Take a course.

requirement_definitions.title: Additional CS Course
requirement_definitions.narrative: Take one additional course in Computer Science. This can be an intermediate course not already used towards your intermediate courses.

requirement_definitions.title: A 1000-Level Course
requirement_definitions.narrative: A 1000-level course in Computer Science or from the list of approved courses.

requirement_definitions.title: A 1000-Level Course
requirement_definitions.narrative: A 1000-level course in Computer Science or from the list of approved courses.

requirement_definitions.title: Additional CS Course (Breadth)
requirement_definitions.narrative: A 1000-level course, that is neither Core, nor Related for the chosen Pathways.

requirement_definitions.title: Capstone Course
requirement_definitions.narrative: Indicate the pathway course you are using for your capstone.

requirement_definitions.title: Calculus Prerequisite
requirement_definitions.narrative: Student must either complete or place out of second-semester calculus, i.e., MATH 100, 170, or 190. Note that students who have not had sufficient calculus in high school may need to take Math 90 (or other courses) before taking a second-semester calculus course.

requirement_definitions.title: Introductory Courses
requirement_definitions.narrative: Students must complete one introductory course sequence.

requirement_definitions.title: CSCI0150 (1.0): Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming and Computer Science

requirement_definitions.title: CSCI0180 (1.0): Computer Science: An Integrated Introduction
CSCI0190 (1.0): Accelerated Introduction to Computer Science
Advanced Intro course
requirement_definitions.narrative: Any more advanced course, or CSCI 0180.

requirement_definitions.title: Intermediate Courses
requirement_definitions.narrative: ScB students must take a total of five intermediate courses, with at least one from each of the three categories.

requirement_definitions_json.title: Professional Track
requirement_definitions_json.narrative: To complete this track, students must complete the requirements for their concentrations and complete two two- to four-month full-time professional experiences, doing work that is related to their concentration programs. Such work is normally done within an industrial organization, but may also be at a university under the supervision of a faculty member.
